means: 解（渴）( quench的过去式和过去分词 )
将（热物体）放入水中急速冷却

sentence.Network_en: He quenched his thirst with a long drink of cold water.
I quenched my thirst with a glass of cold beer.
sentence.Network_cn: 我喝了一杯冰啤酒解渴.

sentence.Network_en: Hot steel is quenched to harden it.
sentence.Network_cn: 烧热的钢放入水中骤冷使之坚硬.

entry.def: If someone who is thirsty quenches their thirst, they lose their thirst by having a drink.

example.ex: He stopped to quench his thirst at a stream.
example.tran: 他停了下来，在小溪边饮水止渴。

sentences.sentence: "his thirst quenched he was able to continue"
"an uprising quenched almost before it started"
